prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Louisa County (Va.) Records, circa 1700-1909, undated. Local government records collection, Louisa County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These boxes came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Louisa County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Louisa County was named for Louisa, a daughter of King George II. The county was formed from Hanover County in 1742.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Louisa County (Va.) Records, circa 1700-1909, undated, consist of the following series: Business Records, Court Records (subfield series include Clerks' Records, Judgments, Criminal Records and Jury Records), Election Records, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Fiduciary Records, Justice of the Peace Records, County Administrative Records (subfield series include Treasurer's Records, Commissioner of the Revenue Records, Overseers of the Poor Records, Board of Supervisor's Records: Road and Bridge Records and Sheriff's Records), Land Records, Road and Bridge Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, Miscellaneous Records and Marriage Records and Vital Statistics.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Louisa County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
